thread.title: College Sports: Report: Texas A&M has half as many NFL combine invites as the entire Big 12 | SportsDay
thread.title_full: College Sports: Report: Texas A&M has half as many NFL combine invites as the entire Big 12 | SportsDay

author: Ben Ba
title: College Sports: Report: Texas A&M has half as many NFL combine invites as the entire Big 12 | SportsDay
text:
â€” Cole Cubelic (@colecubelic) February 13, 2017 
A&M fans will look at this number to strengthen the argument that leaving the Big 12 prior to the 2012 season was a good decision. The A&M detractors, on the other hand, will point out that the Aggies lost to a Big 12 team in the Texas Bowl this year (that team, Kansas State, only has one combine invitation) and is 21-19 in conference play since joining the SEC. 
But no matter what side of the argument you're on, it's clear A&M will have at least a few quality draft prospects, including defensive end Myles Garrett. 
The potential top overall pick, Garrett, joins wide receiver Josh Reynolds, safety Justin Evans and offensive tackle Avery Gennesy as those expected to be among the A&M representatives at the combine.
